titlestmt.titleproper: Rockefeller University records, Special Events and Activities, Audiovisual Materials, Lectures and Assorted Events
A Guide to the Rockefeller University records, Special Events and Activities, Audiovisual Materials, Lectures and Assorted Events FA953

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2019-12-04 00:40:52 -0500.

did.unittitle: Rockefeller University records, Special Events and Activities, Audiovisual Materials, Lectures and Assorted Events
did.physdesc: 5 storage cartons. Unless otherwise noted, all tapes are 7 inch reels.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Deposited with the Rockefeller University archives by the Rockefeller University Press, January 1976.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged in chronological order A, B, 1-143. They are numbered consecutively, but in some cases, as for example, The Christmas Lectures, they have been removed from this collection and maintained separately. Starting 1975 The Rockefeller University Lectures have also been maintained separately.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The consecutive listing which follows covers the 1962-1975 group of taped events. The card catalog has been used to supply author/title or subject approach to the collection.

Consists of a group of tapes which recorded some Rockefeller University events from 1962-1975. They are numbered A, B, 1 — 143 and include addresses at Convocations; Sigma Xi Lectures; Seminars for Science Writing Fellows; Darwin Lectures; The Rockefeller Institute Lectures; Conferences; AAAS Lectures or Discussions; The Forum, etc.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation note
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for research. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC. Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) or audiovisual material (audio cassettes, VHS, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist.

did.unittitle: James D. Watson - The First Two Years of the National Cancer Advisory Board
Isaac Asimov discusses "The Greatest Adventure"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: From container annotations: "The Greatest Adventure" is a book that is the brain-child of seventeen eminent scientists who deal with the nature of the basic research that shapes our lives, e.g. what is the relation between brain research and disease?
